website_summaries.verdict: Entry-level Husqvarna model for basic yard work. We recommend replacing the original string with a thicker line for better results.
pros: Affordable price for a light- to medium-duty gas trimmer
cons: Not easy to start, requires purging and choking
Curved shaft is shorter than straight shaft

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Besides being heavy, and awkward, this thing just doesn't start easy. Mine stopped running in less that two seasons despite a new sparks plug. There is nothing else to replace. Would not recommend, expected more from this name brand. Bought an Echo from Home Depot, spend the money and get something that works every time, is balanced and dependable. I have a big yard and wasted a lot of time with this junk.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Psota

customer_reviews.title: Starter Rope Won't Retract After 1 Use
customer_reviews.text: Started fine on first use out of the box, no issues. Ran fine, Trimmed for about 5 minutes. Turned it off. Decided to trim some more. Literally on only the second use out of the box it started ....but the starter rope won't retract and now I can't start it for that reason, Not at all happy with this product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Engine bogs quite a bit.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a little disappointed in the performance of the engine. I have been through and through the manual, doing everything according to it, but the engine still seems to bog off and on until I level it and rev it up to get the RPMs going. Then things are fine for a while. Other than that, I do really like the design and machine itself.
customer_reviews.author: Anne C.

customer_reviews.title: highly recomend
customer_reviews.text: So far the weeder works great, had a few minors problems at first where i had to run it half choked for heavy cutting, but by 3rd use everything was fine, i do recomend not using the string that is included, it is crap , i use a 5 sided cutting string, this weeder seems to be strong enough to take down 2 ft dense weeds you just have to do 2 -3 cuts , it will sometime bog down in power for a few seconds when you first bump the line out ,but then cuts great, myself i get about an acre cut on 1 tank of gas but that is heavy cutting
customer_reviews.author: G.P

customer_reviews.title: Loses power once it touches weeds
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my fiance last may. It continuously stops running while he is weed eating. Tried multiple different things have found no issue. Runs fine in the air but looses all power once put to weeds. Would not recommend purchase.
customer_reviews.author: njones

customer_reviews.title: MISS ADJUSTED FROM THE FACTORY
customer_reviews.text: GOOD TRIMMER BUT IN HEAVY WEEDS IT BOGS OUT . FULL THROTTLE NEEDS TO BE ADJUSTED . OR YOU CAN LEAVE THE CHOKE ON IN THE FIRST POSITION AND IT WORKS WELL. NOT A PERMANENT FIX . I HAVE READ THIS IN OTHER REVIEWS ALSO.
customer_reviews.author: D R.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box with a little gas this fired up and trimmed the whole 13000 sq/ft lot. Curved Shaft trimmers are always a little shorter than i liek; but it works
customer_reviews.author: S D

customer_reviews.title: Received quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon did everything right. The item arrived with a factory defect (gas tank not formed right). After several calls, had the item repaired at the local dealer location under warranty. Besides losing two weeks of usage, and having to take and pickup unit from dealership, things turned out o.k.
customer_reviews.author: Jmac28610

customer_reviews.title: Great Product fast shipping will recommend
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping. Great Product. Runs great starts easy easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Country boy

customer_reviews.title: great little trimmer
customer_reviews.text: add some startron (tiny bit) to gas, to keep it from clogging up when sitting for long time as these do...works awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Human

customer_reviews.title: So Far, So Good
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to gas-powered after using a battery-powered trimmer for years and the difference is immense. My only complaints are that I have to tilt the trimmer so that I don't overfill the tank (which also runs out a little too quickly), and the trimmer line it comes with isn't very good. I replaced the trimmer line (after watching a Youtube video on how to do it), and now I have no complaints about it.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Very unhappy
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money. Wanted to return the weed trimmer because the trim line is impossible to re-spool. The engine throttle is made of cheap plastic and feels like it will break quickly. Tried to return the weed trimmer and amazon will not allow me. Should have bought a black and decker or craftsman.
customer_reviews.author: Steven S.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality replacement trimmer.
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for a tired, brand x trimmer. It was a couple pounds heavier and has taken a bit of adjustment to get used to but does a decent job.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Starts nice! Well balanced and easier on my back than my previous weed eaters. Quality product.
customer_reviews.author: kevin webber

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 2 1/2 years ago and I really really like it. It runs all my attachments real well and I can't find anything negative to say about it. Easy to start and easy to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This weed eater works better than any of the ones that I have used before. Amazon saved the day again for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Allen Peacock

customer_reviews.title: Easy to start and well built
customer_reviews.text: So far this string trimmer has been easy to start and stays running. The string is easy to feed and easy to re-spool.
customer_reviews.author: M.Reed

customer_reviews.title: Love this Thing
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase decision. The attachments from Home Depot or Lowes and other BBS works for this.
customer_reviews.author: MarshMania

customer_reviews.title: Reliable brand/product
customer_reviews.text: Got this weed trimmer for my dad to replace his old Husqvarna trimmer that just broke down after many years of use. He likes brand/model because it’s pretty light, easy to start and has enough power for his needs. Also accepts other attachments like an edger and pole saw. So far, he is very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect edging
customer_reviews.text: Great performance! I have owned many different brands in the past. This by far has outperformed the others.
customer_reviews.author: Brian L

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: One of the best weed eaters I have purchased. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Rough Start But Better Now
customer_reviews.text: There was an issue that needed repair after the first time I used the unit and it took Husqvarna a month+ to acknowledge the product was registered and covered under warranty. I did get it back and it's working very well right now after several uses.
customer_reviews.author: Fritz P Chlanda

customer_reviews.title: Used one time and the motor broke
customer_reviews.text: I have been loyal to this brand for 12 years. I used it one time and the motor broke. I am a few days off of the replacement date. So now I've spent almost $200 and am not able to return or exchange this time. Extremely disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great. I had a cheaper brand one for about ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I had a cheaper brand one for about $100 that didn't have what it really takes to clear heavier grass out. This has been perfect so far and won't stop cutting, ever.
customer_reviews.author: Sean L.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it unless you are ready to buy another one
customer_reviews.text: A very good product but Husqvarna does warranty the product no matter what they say
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I have an 223L and couldn't resist picking up this one for a backup. Nice value.
customer_reviews.author: Eldon Kratz

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT
customer_reviews.text: Runs great. Very smooth. Cuts grass/weeds with no problem. Re-spooling line is simple.
customer_reviews.author: JOSEPH D.

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy This Product
customer_reviews.text: I followed every step in the Owner's Manual to assemble and start this weed trimmer and it will not start and run for use. I also completed every trouble shooting step with no luck. Buy a different weed trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Krista Williams

customer_reviews.title: Time.
customer_reviews.text: My Husband Loves it. No more cords to drag around. 😛
customer_reviews.author: Terri L.Busse

customer_reviews.title: I just love it
customer_reviews.text: I just love my machine. This Huqvarna does everything I ask of it. It starts when cold. It starts when hot. It does not bog down in high weeds. Best I ever had!
customer_reviews.author: Kay B Miller

customer_reviews.title: Works well into it's second season
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer has worked very well without problem But we only used it about 12-14 times.
customer_reviews.author: 2tmc

customer_reviews.title: frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Bought this new on amazon and it leaks gas. Now I have to take it to a dealer to get a brand new weed wacker repaired before I ever even got to use it. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Hegyi

customer_reviews.title: Quality Performance
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this weed whacker, better than any battery powered one I've ever used. Sounds like a turbo charger winding up. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Franky

customer_reviews.title: works perfect for what I do
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I looking for , works perfect for what I do .
customer_reviews.author: Credomatic

customer_reviews.title: Received electric chain saw.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the gas Weedwhacker, received an electric chainsaw and was told it is not returnable???
customer_reviews.author: John Oster

customer_reviews.title: Quality trimmer. Works with attachments.
customer_reviews.text: Started on 3rd pull, as expected. Looking forward to new machine. Easy to load string. Works with my other attachments.
customer_reviews.author: Herman G

customer_reviews.title: Husqvarna 128CD 17" Cutting Path? The box is labeled 16".  It is not a 17" cutting path.
customer_reviews.text: Husqvarna 128CD 17" Cutting Path? The box is labeled 16". It is not a 17" cutting path.
customer_reviews.author: Donna L.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is the best Weed Eater I have ever bought! Just follow the instructions!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Haley

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: The trimmer was everything we expected and more. Easy to handle and great quality!
customer_reviews.author: Gloria M. Heuer

customer_reviews.title: By far one of the best trimmers to own
customer_reviews.text: Get this bad boy hooked up with some ugly line .095 and it will
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easily the best trimmer I’ve ever had
customer_reviews.text: Changing line is a breeze. Starting is still first pull in my third summer.
customer_reviews.author: Ponderer-wanderer

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great weed eater. Did the whole yard in almost half the time as my last weed eater....Am planning to buy 5 more for others.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Chand

customer_reviews.title: Great Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, starts right up. My husband loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This product is great and excellent value for the money I paid, comparing it to models in Home Depot and Lowes
customer_reviews.author: Mike Watson

customer_reviews.title: It was extremely disappointing
customer_reviews.text: It was expensive, but I will pay for a quality engineered product that will last. I had an old Ryobi that lasted nearly twenty years. The new powerhead I bought for it didn't last over 5 hrs of actual use. This should have plenty of power, but doesn't even rival the cheapo models. It bogs down in the grass too easily. It doesn't completely die but is horrible for what is supposed to be a top brand for tool engines.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Taylor Seagull

customer_reviews.title: This trimmer is great. I live in NC and fortunately get a ...
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is great. I live in NC and fortunately get a break from cutting the lawn for a few months every year. This trimmer will start up flawlessly after sitting for months!
customer_reviews.author: Rolf

customer_reviews.title: Then runs fine. If not for this it would have 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: Takes too long to warm up. Then runs fine. If not for this it would have 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Zimbauer

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: This barely works. It is not fuel as I use only the premixed ethanol-free fuel in it. It barely runs and chugs a tank of gasoline every 15 minutes. I regret buying this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: GalvezGuy

customer_reviews.title: I don't think this is a bad weed eater
customer_reviews.text: I sent mine back, mostly because it lacked the power I wanted and was too short. We have Saint Augustine grass and it didn't have the power to cut through it while edging without bogging down. I debated on the curved shaft because I am 6'2" and didn't want to have to bend over so much but another review said the shaft length was longer so I went with it - it wasn't. I will opt for the longer straight shaft next time. I don't think this is a bad weed eater, I have a husky lawnmower and it is awesome, but it was too short for me and didn't have the power most claimed it to have.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Craven

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Lived up to expectations so far
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Lived up to expectations so far. Wish it used .095 line instead of .080. Goes thru the lighter line faster than you would expect, otherwise very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: A. Landrigan

customer_reviews.title: Good as New
customer_reviews.text: Everything like new. Easy starting. String management is a little tricky, but I need to get the hang of it I suspect.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Haigh

customer_reviews.title: 4 months old and won't start.  Throwing in the towel.  Piece of junk.
customer_reviews.text: Can't start. Haven't been able to weed eat in last 4 weeks. Always difficult to start, now nothing. Religiously followed the purge and choke procedure. Thought I would try big name once, now disappointed. Going back to Craftsman.
customer_reviews.author: BrianS

customer_reviews.title: Motor wouldn't stay on. :(
customer_reviews.text: Five minutes into the weed eating, the motor would die. This happened over and over, no matter who tried to start it or keep it running. I don't know if it was just a defective units or not. Amazon did, however, refund our money as soon as I took it to UPS.
customer_reviews.author: SAM72

customer_reviews.title: I love Husqvarna, but that love is now tarnished
customer_reviews.text: I love all my Husqvarna equipment and after my last string trimmer died, I figured I couldn't go wrong with anything Husqvarna. Well....I was wrong. The trimmer would start just fine, but would not run at full throttle. It would just bog down and die. If I let the choke at about 1/4, it would run ok. Called Husqvarna support but their suggestion was to take it to a service center. I just bought the thing, so I'm not wasting my time going to a service center for s string trimmer. Bummer, I just retuned it.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Marginal at best
customer_reviews.text: It runs but not too easy to start it's also heavy when used without a shoulder strap. Once it starts it does a pretty good job.
customer_reviews.author: BritBrat

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: well balanced and very comfortable to hold for long periods
customer_reviews.author: Haimroy R.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: First time using it and it bogs down as soon as I try to cut it with. Trimmer is waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: david ragas

customer_reviews.title: good trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer came with all of the opperating istructions and started up great. It seems to be a little under powered compared to my other Smaller Echo trimmer that this replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Not Telling

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Snap in shaft was very loose. Tried to snug up 1/4" nut and the threads broke.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Husqvarna 128CD 17" Cutting Path, Detachable Gas String Trimmer
product_meta.description: The curved 128CD is your go to gas trimmer when you need a powerful & easy to use tool for grass, weeds & more. Our Smart start trimmer technology reduces starter cord resistance by 40% to allow for easy engine starts & the strong, braided trimmer line is ready for work. A high visibility cutting shield helps protect you from flying rocks & debris, while giving you better visibility of your cutting area. The trimmer is easy to store & transport thanks to the detachable head feature. Part of a smart multi-tool family, The 128CD string trimmer power base is compatible with three "click on" Attachments - purchase the edger, cultivator & Pole saw attachments to tackle multiple jobs in your yd.
feature_bullets: Features a 28cc 2-cycle engine which powers the 17 inch (cutting width) trimmer head
The curved shaft design helps to evenly distribute the weight of the trimmer so you can operate for longer periods with greater comfort
Trimmer engine runs on a mixture of unleaded gas and 2-cycle oil (2. 6 oz. Bottle is included, see bottle for mixing instructions)
Have no worries when it is time to replace the trimmer line - the T25 trimmer head is designed for simple and easy line reloading
A translucent fuel tank allows you to visually Monitor your fuel level as you work
Conveniently remove unwanted air from the carburetor and Fuel system using the air purge primer bulb

Utilize the full potential of this tool with the optional trimmer attachments: The edger keeps your lawn, pathways and flowers beds looking neat with a clearly defined edge (952711607); the cultivator is great for tilling smaller areas in your yard like flower beds and beneath trees (952711608); the pole saw gives you extra reach when you need it for those hard to reach limbs (952711672)
String trimmer is backed by a 2-year limited for residential use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars178 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
